text: Budelli is a small island in the Maddalena Archipelago off the northeastern coast of Sardinia, Italy. It is famous for its Spiaggia Rosa (Pink Beach), whose unique color comes from crushed coral and shells. Protected as part of a national park, Budelli's pristine coastline and turquoise waters make it a jewel of the Mediterranean. == References == Category:Islands of Italy Category:Sardinia
title: Budelli
